Canadian Digital Service (CDS) | Service numérique canadien (SNC)
A callback lets you receive messages from Notify to a URL you choose.
You’ll need to provide a bearer token, for security. We’ll add this to the authorisation header of the callback request.
The callback message is in JSON.
Email and text message delivery receipts
When you send an email or text message through Notify, we can send a receipt to your callback URL to tell you if we were able to deliver it or not.
The reference sent by the service
The email address of the recipient
The time the service sent the request
The last time the status was updated
The time the notification was sent
If your service receives text messages in Notify, we can forward them to your callback URL as soon as they arrive.
The phone number the message was sent from
The number the message was sent to (your number)
The UTC datetime that the message was received by Notify

Notify puts small files (known as ‘cookies’) onto your computer.
These cookies are used to remember you once you’ve logged in.
We store session cookies on your computer to help keep your information secure while you use the service.
Used to keep you logged in
When you first use the service, you may see a pop-up ‘welcome’ message. Once you’ve seen the message, we store a cookie on your computer so it knows not to show it again.
Saves a message to let us know that you have seen our cookie message
Integrate the Notify API to send messages automatically.
The API is available using clients developed by GOV.UK.
Avant d'intégrer l'API avec les clients de Notification ci-dessous, vous devez modifier votre point de terminaison vers https://api.notification.alpha.canada.ca.
Comment changer votre point de terminaison
Before integrating the API, using the Notify clients below, you need to change your endpoint to https://api.notification.alpha.canada.ca.

If you work for the federal government, you can use Notify to update your users.
Notify makes it easy to create, customize and send:
You do not need technical knowledge to use Notification.
target: You do not need technical knowledge to use Notify.

source: for free and try it yourself.
To send an email or text with Notify, you need to create a message template first.
Templates let you send the same thing to lots of people, as often as you need, without writing a new message each time.
Notify makes it easy to send personalised messages from a single template.

If you want to include personalised content in your message, you can add a placeholder. Each time you send a message, you can fill the placeholder with details such as a name or reference number. You can do this manually or upload a list of personal details and let Notify do it for you.
To send a batch of messages at once, upload a list of contact details to Notify. You can also schedule the date and time for sending emails or text messages.
You can integrate Notify’s API with your web application or back-office system to send messages automatically.
Notify’s real-time dashboard lets you see the number of messages sent. You can also check the current status of any message to learn when it was delivered.
Control which members of your team can see, create, edit, and send messages.
set different permission levels for each team member
invite team members who don’t have a government email address
choose who else can manage team members
Notify protects and manages data to meet the needs of government services.
Notify lets you redact personal information from your messages after they’ve been sent. Only the recipient can see their personal information.
Notify uses two-factor authentication (2FA) to keep your account secure. When you log in, we'll send a unique one-time code to your phone and ask you to enter it before we let you use your account.
We’ll send you an email to create a new password.

Notify’s real-time dashboard lets you check when your message was delivered. You can also check the status of your messages
this information is only available for 7 days after a message has been sent. You can download a report, including a list of sent messages, for your own records.

A picture of the sending flow of messages in Notify, showing the three states of Sending, Delivered, and Failed. Also shows the next steps when messages fail, deleting data and trying a new method for permanent failures, and trying again or trying a new method for temporary failures
Notify has the following types of message status (API message status may be different and is found in
Notify has sent the message to the email provider.
The message was successfully delivered. Notify will not tell you if a user has opened or read a message.
The provider could not deliver the message because the email address was wrong. You should remove this email address from your database.
The provider could not deliver the message after trying for 72 hours. This can happen when the recipient’s inbox is full. You can try to send the message again.
There was a connection problem between Notify and the email provider. You’ll have to try sending your messages again.
Notify has sent the message to the cellular provider.
The message was sent to an international number. The mobile networks in some countries do not provide any more delivery information.

The provider could not deliver the message because the phone number was wrong. You should remove this phone number from your database. You’ll still be charged for text messages to numbers that do not exist.

The provider could not deliver the message after trying for 72 hours. This can happen when the recipient’s phone is off. You can try to send the message again. You’ll still be charged for text messages to phones that are not accepting messages.

There was a connection problem between Notify and the cellular provider. You’ll have to try sending your message again. You will not be charged for text messages that are affected by a technical failure.
You can now create a new password for your account.

Send service updates by email and text message
Try out Notify, a new messaging platform for the Government of Canada.
Send emails or text messages to keep the public informed and make your services more transparent.
Use templates for easy, consistent, and accessible communications.
Staff who regularly write and send service updates wishing to upgrade the tools used to communicate with the public
Developers working on improving workflow and tooling for public servants
Administrators who have to meet departmental service standards for communication
Upload lists of recipients and send personalised messages in bulk
Create templates and save them for future messages
Track the status of the messages you send
See how Notify can improve your workflow
You can integrate Notify with your current system to take advantage of secure, cloud-based messaging tools.
Notify supports roles and permissions, so that you can adjust which staff have access to send or edit messages.
Learn how to integrate the Notify API
Notify is free for Government of Canada services
Use Notify for free and replace paper letters or costly third-party messaging services.
Notify is a service managed by the Canadian Digital Service — no external procurement.

These terms apply to use of Notify. Your account manager must accept them.
Follow Canadian law with regard to the Privacy Act when using this software.
complete all security steps required by your organisation.
tell us immediately if you have any security breaches.
keep your API (Application Programming Interface) codes secure. API technology allows different software applications to communicate with each other.
get consent to send messages and to use data. This consent must meet standards set by privacy legislation including the federal Privacy Act.
check that the data you add to Notify is accurate and complies with privacy legislation including the federal Privacy Act.
not send messages containing any personally or commercially sensitive information.

not send unsolicited messages. Messages must be about transactions or subscriptions. Please follow the transaction and subscription criteria in the GOV.UK Service Manual. Please remember that other parts of the GOV.UK Manual may not apply in the Canadian context.
If you don’t follow these terms, we may need to stop sending your messages.
send the messages you write, as long as these messages comply with our terms of use.
show how Notify is working through our performance and status pages.
give you one month’s notice by email if we change our terms of use or delivery providers.

When you set up a new service it will start in trial mode. This lets you try out Notify, with a few restrictions.
A service in trial mode can only:
send 50 text messages and emails per day
send messages to you and other people in your team
create letter templates, but not send them

gc notify, notify, canada notify, canada email, email notifications, Government of Canada, federal government, Canada SMS, Canada Notification service
Notify is built for the needs of government services. It has processes in place to:
when it passes through the service
when it’s stored on the service

All data, including email addresses, phone numbers, and information in personalized messages are stored for 7 days within the system database. The exception is data files uploaded to the system. These are held for 30 days to allow for advanced scheduling of emails.
for more information on how personal information is handled by Notify.
Other technical security controls on Notify include
Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat (TBS) cloud guardrails
Canadian Centre for Cyber Security (CCCS) Information Technology Security Guidance (ITSG-33)
protective monitoring to record activity, and raise alerts about any suspicious activity
using JSON Web Tokens, to avoid sending API keys when your service talks to Notify
Some messages include sensitive information like security codes or password reset links.

If you’re sending a message with sensitive information, you can choose to hide those details on the Notify dashboard once the message has been sent. This means that only the message recipient will be able to see that information.
You can set different user permissions in Notify. This lets you control who in your team has access to certain parts of the service.
To create an account on Notify, you’ll need to enter:
a code that Notify sends to your phone or email
Once you have logged in the first time, you can add a hardware-based security key to further increase the security of your account.
If you are having issues creating or accessing your account, email our support team at
Our approach to information risk management follows TBS guidance. It assesses:
This approach also applies to the service providers Notify uses to send messages.
Things we do to manage risks on Notify include:
formal risk assessments based on TBS and CCCS guidance
residual risk statement preparation and active management of the risk treatment plan
Notify has been assessed and authorized for operation by the CDS Chief Executive Officer, as the senior authorizing official for the service. This ATO will be re-assessed on at least an annual basis.
You can use Notify to send messages designated up to and including “Protected A” per the Standard on Security Categorization.
Should an incident happen, we have a comprehensive incident response and customer notification procedures in place.
Should you suspect a security breach or have discovered a vulnerability in the service, email us at
